text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Former senior U.S. officials press Israeli government not to expand settlements.
- Arafat and Netanyahu spoke by phone in effort to renew confidence between Israel and Palestinian Authority.
- Iran bought submarine which changes balance of power in the Gulf, according to Israeli estimates.
- Ministers still revising cuts, two days after deadline.
- Avis sees 10 percent sales growth in Israel in 1997.
- Arafat and Netanyahu agreed to resume talks on Hebron.
- Shin Bet shocked at Netanyahu's claim that security officials urged him to open Jerusalem tunnel in September.
- 83-year-old woman says gold teeth were pulled from her mouth during robbery.
- Inflation this year will reach 10.5 percent.
